message.content: This question requires an understanding of how light and distance interact. As the plane ascends and travels further away, the lights appear duller. This is because the distance between the plane and the viewer increases, causing the intensity of the light to decrease. Option (A) is incorrect because as the plane moves away, the lights actually appear dimmer. Option (C) is incorrect because the lights on the plane are not physically getting closer to the viewer. Option (D) is incorrect because the lights on the plane do not appear bigger as the plane moves away.

This question requires an understanding of the behavior of light and the effects of distance on perception. As the plane ascends and travels further away, the lights appear duller. This is because as the distance between the observer and the lights increases, the amount of light reaching the observer decreases. Option (A) is incorrect because the lights actually appear less bright. Option (C) is incorrect because the lights are actually further away. Option (D) is incorrect because the lights do not appear bigger, but rather smaller as they recede into the distance.

This question requires understanding of the concept of atmospheric perspective. As the plane ascends and travels to its destination, the lights on the plane appear duller. This is because as the plane gets higher in the sky, there is more air between the viewer and the lights. This increase in atmospheric particles scatters the light, making it appear duller. Option (A) is incorrect because the lights would not become brighter as the plane ascends. Option (C) is incorrect because the lights on the plane are not getting physically closer to the viewer. Option (D) is incorrect because the size of the lights would not change as the plane ascends.

Option (C) is incorrect because the lights on the plane do not change their proximity to the observer. Option (D) is incorrect because the size of the lights does not change as the plane moves away.

Option (A) is incorrect because the lights do not get brighter. Option (C) is incorrect because the lights do not get closer. Option (D) is incorrect because the lights do not get bigger.
